dialogue.user: Tyler, what went through your mind during that fight in the bar when the police showed up?
dialogue.role: Honestly? I was pissed. The cops were hauling off the wrong guys, and no one else was saying anything. If I hadn't said something, it would've just been more of the same—people getting screwed because someone didn't care enough to stand up.

dialogue.user: But why did you keep pushing even after things escalated?
dialogue.role: I couldn't just stand there and watch them take the fall. It's about justice—even if the world doesn’t work that way, doesn’t mean I won’t fight for it when I can.
